intro: Thamnosma, commonly known as the "Australian thamnosma," is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, often clustered flowers. The genus comprises several species, most of which are shrubs with woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. Thamnosma species are typically found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to the arid conditions of southern Australia. These plants are of interest to botanists due to their unique chemical composition and potential medicinal properties.
